article_title: Obamacare chief says UCSF research can help lower drug prices
article_text:
Obamacare chief says UCSF research can help lower drug prices

The Obama Administration’s top healthcare official said Thursday that personalized medicine research championed by UC San Francisco could help lower the cost of blockbuster drugs.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: By Thomas Lee
article_metadata.description: In a visit to the school’s Mission Bay campus, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell acknowledged the extraordinary cost of breakthrough therapies like Sovaldi, the hepatitis C drug made by Gilead Science in Foster City that costs $1,000 a pill.  [...] the president recently proposed a $215 million initiative to fund a national database of one million people who will voluntarily share information like medical records and genetic data.  In theory, scientists can use the database to help craft therapies tailored to the genetic makeup of the individual patient and lower the cost of treatment.  “Why does it cost so much?” Yamamoto said.  Because medicine is so imprecise.
